title: Microsoft unveils AirPods rival and teases dual-screen Surface Neo
text:
New York (CNN Business) Microsoft (MSFT) took direct aim at Apple during its annual Surface event in New York on Wednesday.

Apple AAPL The company unveiled its new Surface Earbuds, wireless earbuds that are clearly intended as a rival offering to's AirPods. Earbuds will work with Microsoft Office products and boast a full day of battery life, according to the company.

The product will be available later this year for $249, or slightly more than the $199 Apple charges for AirPods with a wireless charging case.

In an unusual move, Microsoft also teased a new dual-screen device called the Surface Neo that won't be available until next holiday season, more than a year from now. The device combines two 9-inch screens and folds inward. You can flip it, reverse it and surf Netflix. It's also possible to expand a single app across the two screens or use two apps at the same time.

"Neo is not only the next new Surface, it's the next category," Panos Panay, Microsoft's chief product officer, said at the event.

Read More
description: All of the biggest announcements, new releases and hardware that Microsoft announced Wednesday in New York City.
